attributes.action: Prevent the current changes to pharmacy regulations being debated by the DoH
attributes.background: The planned changes to pharmacy regulations aim to allow a pharmacy to open and allow prescription-only medicines to be given out without a Responsible Pharmacist present. This will inevitably result in both patient harm and reduced access to pharmacy services for patients.
attributes.additional_details: The government has said that they wish to "better utilise the skills of pharmacists in healthcare settings such as hospitals and GP practices", but have put no proposals forward to guarantee jobs for the many community pharmacists and Locums that this will put out of work. People who have been at the heart of the community helping patients will now find themselves without work, and those patients will find they have reduced access to pharmacy services.

attributes.action: Make MPs provide an annual report to constituents on the work they've done
attributes.background: We are often told by politicians of their intentions at the time they wish for a vote, but accountability is often lost between elections. I ask that all politicians be required to provide a full, non election based report to all constituents on the progress they make on their pledges and beyond.

attributes.action: Cyclists to wear mandatory cycling helmet, high viz vest and front light.
attributes.background: A lack of legislation to cyclists poses risk to pedestrians and to other road users due to their lack of visibility. The government should pass a legislation for mandatory wear of cycling helmet, high visibility vest and a front regulated light permanently switched-on at all time while cycling.

attributes.action: More citizen, human and working rights lessons into the educational curriculum
attributes.background: a lot of blood and tears was spilled building the cornerstones of what rights we enjoy today as humans, citizens and workers. Unfortunately a lot of young people miss out on this vital information and children should be educated about what rights they have so they are prepared for the real world

attributes.action: Remove police cautions from criminal records after 10 years.
attributes.background: A lot of people have accepted a police caution in the past after being told by the police that it isn't the same as a criminal conviction and it wont appear on their criminal record, only to find many years later that it appears on advanced criminal record checks affecting their ability to work.

attributes.action: Have Friday , Saturday and Sunday as a day of for all school children.
attributes.background: Going to school can be a mentally and physically demanding process and I believe children need an extra day off every week.
attributes.additional_details: I always have always  struggled mentally and physically demanding going to school five days a week.

attributes.action: UK residents with ILR to access EU passport or fast track queues at UK Borders
attributes.background: UK residents lose considerable time and productivity to long queues at UK Borders. A registered traveller scheme exists for frequent non-resident visitors from several countries to access faster clearance at the Border. A similar system should be implemented free of charge for residents with ILR.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/registered-traveller/eligibility

attributes.action: Fund research into Granuloma Annulare
attributes.background: Granuloma Annulare is a skin condition which causes an unsightly rash and severe itching and there is no known cure for it.
attributes.additional_details: I run a Facebook page for this condition and have hundreds of members all who are getting nowhere in the UK when they go to see a dermatologist. This needs to change.

attributes.action: Enlarge the area eligible for high cost area supplements for NHS staff
attributes.background:
The cost of living in South East England in areas such as Brighton and Hove is now on par with London. 

NHS staff in these areas are struggling to meet the basic costs of living such as rent, food and travel. We propose extending the fringe area eligible for high cost area supplement to Sussex.

attributes.action: There Must be Prison For Attacks on Police, Minimum Prison Sentence Six Months.
attributes.background: As we rely on the Police for Protection so they Must be Protected when Attacked, Courts should never let the Attackers off with just a Slap on the Hand, Respect is needed not only for the Police but All Emergency Services who do a Great and sometimes Difficult Job, Let’s get them some redress.
attributes.additional_details:
Far too many are getting Attacked these days and costing money in Sick pay which could be spent on Services.

Please support this and get them backing in our Courts.

Thanks

attributes.action: Make employers specify a minimum salary on all job adverts
attributes.background: UK average salary increases insufficient as living costs continue to rise sharply. Job seekers deserve transparency. Companies offering 'competitive' salaries complicate the process of finding employment and hinder job seekers from comparing potential income and making an informed choice.
attributes.additional_details:
If companies are forced to advertise a minimum salary it becomes easier for a job seeker to determine the suitability of a certain position. It cuts the inefficiency of time and money spent on applications with no hope of employment and helps to ensure employers can't widen already established pay gaps, offer job seekers a deserved level of clarify and transparency.

https://www.ons.gov.uk/employmentandlabourmarket/peopleinwork/earningsandworkinghours

attributes.action: Make the Tax-Free Childcare service more transparent for Childcare Providers
attributes.background: There is a complete lack of communication about payments that have been made through Tax-Free Childcare. Providers have an account they can login to, but cannot see any payments that have been made to them.
attributes.additional_details: We rely on parents telling us they have made a payment, and then have to wait until the money is credited to our bank account which can take several working days. We do not get any notification about when a payment is made, and if we call the helpline we are told that information cannot be shared about any pending payments due to data protection. Even on our bank statements, it does not say who the payment has come from. We cannot operate a business like this.

attributes.action: Put grammar schools in all counties
attributes.background: Lots of high school children are held back in their current schools. If they go to a grammar school they will be encouraged, pushed, and will improve greatly!

attributes.action: More funding for the National Health Service and take it out of crisis
attributes.background: I have seen casualty departments where people are begging for help, I've seen where patients are being kept in corridors and I've seen nurses and doctors struggle to provide the appropriate care required when they are stretched to their limit.

attributes.action: Give tax breaks to parents who support their children through university
attributes.background:
I am supporting my daughter through university. 
Why not treat these payments in the same way as gift aid? , reimburse my daughter the 20% tax on the value that I've paid to her?

attributes.action: Lower the price of road tax for petrol and increase the price for diesel
attributes.background: It is said that Diesel cars emit more harmful pollutants, why should road tax be so much cheaper for diesel? it only encourages more people to use diesel.

attributes.action: Ban (Prospective) Employers asking about salary history from job applicants
attributes.background: Law makers say asking about salary history continues the cycle of pay inequality and makes it harder for people to change careers/jobs. The salary question is a hidden,yet,pervasive form of discrimination. It enables employers to use potential employee's past salary to determine the salary to offer.
attributes.additional_details:
Some states in the U.S (e.g. New York city) has already passed the law (in 2017) prohibiting employers to ask about salary history in interviews or on applications.
By banning the question during the hiring process, employers will be required to offer jobs and compensation to prospective employees based on their own skills, merit and demands of the job, not gender, race or ethnicity.
Banning salary history question is the next step to take in the fight to end the pay gap.

attributes.action: Reject the ratification of the Unitary Patent treaty by the UK and Scotland
attributes.background: The Unitary Patent contain articles which refers to the supremacy of the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU), while politicians have promised to respect the democratic Brexit vote of UK citizens to leave the EU; The UPC court will provide case law in favor of software patents.
attributes.additional_details: For a more complete and lengthy petition, see http://nounitarysoftwarepatents.uk

attributes.action: Fine* patients who do not attend (DNA) NHS hospital appointments.
attributes.background:
DNAs: 
- Cost the NHS an estimated £225 million in 2012 to 2013° 
- Result in extended waiting lists 
- Are an inefficient use of staff 
- Occurred in around 5.6 million (9% of the total) NHS outpatient appointments in England between 2014 to 2015°° 
(See additional details for sources °and°°)
attributes.additional_details:
Appointments where a patient does not show or provide prior notice are regarded as DNAs (did not attend). 
*To reduce DNAs, provide an incentive from as little as a £1 circumstantial charge to encourage patients to cancel. Thus freeing a space for those who can attend the appointment.
°Source: The National Audit Office 
°°Source: Quarterly Hospital Activity Data, 2015
Additional information:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/hospitals-and-patients-urged-to-take-action-on-missed-appointments

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for people to pass a politics test before they can vote
attributes.background: Make it a requirement for people to have to pass a political competency test in order to be allowed to vote in General Elections, or in Nationwide Referendums. Brexit is a stark reminder; it only takes a small percentage of the population to be politically uneducated to sway a huge national decision
attributes.additional_details: A exam to test background knowledge of basic political systems, taken a few weeks before an upcoming election. This could then be marked over the following days, and anyone who passed will be sent a verification code or something similar to enable them to vote on Election Day. An in depth analysis of how the population did overall on the exam could then be published, allowing political parties to see what areas of knowledge/ which demographics they could address in future election campaigns.

attributes.action: Make child parking legally badge-held spaces only for those with children.
attributes.background: People are using these spaces without children present causing undue stress and danger to those with a child or children present. We are punished for parking illegally in disabled slots. Why is children parking any different...

attributes.action: Raise awareness of germ spreading by licking fingers to open bags/give out paper
attributes.background: Many stores have staff who decide to lick their fingers to make it easier to open carrier bags. This is a serious health and safety issue as it can cause the spread of illnesses and diseases. It is very unhygienic and disgusting and shouldn't be the norm. They can use water instead.
attributes.additional_details: Licking fingers is also often done within schools, organisations and institutions where they give out papers, forms and applications etc. The UK Government needs to launch an awareness campaign to help stop this unhygienic practice.

attributes.action: Digital Software libraries should be considered to be assets.
attributes.background: Digital Software is everywhere in today's world, this why the UK should be the first country to consider any form of digital software to an asset to the purchaser of that digital software whether it being Operating Systems, Video Games, Music & General Digital Software.
attributes.additional_details:
It has recently come about thanks to video game journalist Chris Bratt that digital software libraries are not considered to be assets and can not be transferred to a loved one if you sadly pass away. Furthermore, when you do sadly pass away these digital libraries of software get deleted wiping all monetary value from them as the terms of service are no longer valid.  

For further information watch Chris Bratt video here.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kHLFUbU5ceI

attributes.action: Reintroduce the old National Curriculum sub‐divided level grading system
attributes.background: From September 2014, the Government made huge changes in the way that students were to be assessed. This was a new way of thinking for schools, looking very different to the previous 20 years. These changes have created confusion among students and parents while decreasing student motivation.
attributes.additional_details: With the old grading system, there was little a correlation between a level and a child’s year group, and this can be seen in the way that in a Year 6 class there could be a range of levels, from level 2 to a level 6. However, the new National Curriculum sets out a mark scheme of a simple emerging, developing, secure, mastery.

attributes.action: Employers’ Education Tax to contribute towards university tuition fee costs
attributes.background:
Employers currently receive the rewards of a highly educated workforce but contribute little or nothing towards the educational costs of their employees.
Employers should pay a 1% tax rate on the gross salary of all employees to help fund the tuition fee costs of all students entering university.
attributes.additional_details:
The new 1% Employers Education Tax will go towards eliminating the tuition fee liability on all existing UK graduates and providing free university tuition fee for all current and future UK students leaving further education.
In addition, individuals who may have missed the opportunity to go to university and who may now, or in the future, wish to pursue a university degree for whatever purpose will be encouraged to apply at all stages of their life and be funded to do so.

attributes.action: Install ANPR systems on the A2 junction with the A282.
attributes.background: Drivers bypass the A282 by using the A2 junction roundabout and then the A225 junction when the traffic is bad. This causes severe delays to Dartford residents going about their daily business. Drivers doing this show no consideration to other drivers and they should be fined for using this dodge.
attributes.additional_details: I live in DA1 and it once took 45 minutes to get to Asda Greenhithe because of this level of inconsiderate driving. Yesterday it accounted for nearly 20 minutes of delay because of HGV drivers blocking the A225 Princes Road junction with the roundabout. Local residents have the right to go about their daily business without the fear of being delayed by such inconsiderate drivers, who are only interested in themselves. Plus there are frequent law infringements on this roundabout.

attributes.action: Ban credit checks for job applications
attributes.background: Most jobs now require credit checks. All of us have a past - should we be judged on our credit? does it affect our ability to work?
attributes.additional_details: The majority of people have at least one debt or more, especially trying to survive on benefits.

attributes.action: Form a public holiday to celebrate our NHS; incl. all in the emergency services
attributes.background:
The NHS is one of our key British Values.

A NHS Day holiday in the summer would serve to underscore our deep admiration for all of those who work in the health and emergency services. With events celebrating its formation, those that serve and events to promote health and community.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is, if anything, one of our key British Values. Given this, is it not time to truly celebrate the NHS!?!?
This would allow a focus of public opinion and need for such a critical part of who we are as a nation, showing the world that this is who we are and what we hold dearest to our hearts. If ever there was a time to show how strong we all feel about the NHS it's now. What better way to do that than a public holiday focused around celebrating this bedrock of our society!

attributes.action: Make driving tests graded to reduce premiums for safer new drivers
attributes.background: Insurance premiums continue to rise for new drivers, as all new drivers are classed as a high risk to the road. By having a grading system in place in the practical driving exam, then the examiner will be able to judge the driver's safety. This may allow a reduction in premiums for safer drivers.

attributes.action: Rebuild the “Hereford, Hay and Brecon” and “Mid-Wales” railways
attributes.background: The Beeching cuts of the 1960s closed a significant number of lines in the Marches and mid-Wales, the return of which would boost the economy and vitality of the area. There would also be a potential reduction in road traffic and therefore of carbon emissions.

attributes.action: "Warning" labels on dog flea shampoos containing Pyrethrum as toxic to cats.
attributes.background: I washed my cat with dog flea shampoo. There was no warning label on the product. In small writing amongst other text it stated it should never be used on cats. Unfortunately, my beloved companion died 2 days later. This type of poisoning is not uncommon.
attributes.additional_details: The product I used was a standard dog flea shampoo purchased over the counter for my dog weeks beforehand, but I didn't think it would be harmful to my cat.  Clear, informed "Warning" labels should be on the front of such products indicating they are toxic to cats. This will hopefully prevent other cats from being harmed or dying as a result of the chemical Pyrethrum which they can't metabolise, yet dogs can.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to prevent farm animals from moving freely for long periods
attributes.background: Many farm animals are prevented from moving by tethering to stanchions in sheds, tie stalls and "zero grazing" systems for dairy cattle - and rarely or never letting them outside. Pigs are given no space to move in tiny "sow stalls" ; chickens by so many being in one shed they can barely move.
attributes.additional_details:
For information on zero grazing systems, tie stalls and tethering by the neck unable to move in dairy farming see this link
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235185/the-life-of-dairy-cows.pdf
On "sow stalls" for pigs leaving them unable to move at all
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235118/The-life-of-Pigs.pdf
Chickens farmed for meat
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235306/The-life-of-Broiler-chickens.pdf
Chickens farmed for eggs
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235024/The-life-of-laying-hens.pdf

attributes.action: Give adoption allowance to self employed people
attributes.background:
If you are employed and pregnant you are entitled to maternity pay.
If you are employed and adopting a child you are entitled to adoption pay.
If you are self employed and pregnant you are entitled to maternity allowance.
If you are self employed and adopting a child you are entitled to NOTHING!!
attributes.additional_details:
Please support people who are self employed and are wanting to provide a loving and stable home for a child in need.
The financial situation is very important in the adoption process as you need to be able to provide for a child emotionally and financially, no adoption allowance can stand in the way of prospective adoptive parents being approved.
Thank you.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for supermarket chains to display air miles on fruit.
attributes.background: Fresh fruit often travels to the UK by air, which creates huge amounts of CO2. People need the information on packaging to make choices and reduce their CO2 footprint.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people do not realise the CO2  of their food, especially when it travels by air. Aeroplanes are huge contributors to climate change.
Providing the air travel information on fruit packaging would give people the tools to reduce their CO2 footprint, and help us stop climate change.

attributes.action: Keep the Panavia Tornado in service for another few years
attributes.background: The Tornado is one of the most capable and advanced strike aircraft currently fielded by any air force today, and RAF Tornados are currently conducting airstrikes on insurgents in the Middle East, and the Tornado will be kept in service by Germany until 2025, so why can’t we?

attributes.action: Make the UK Government Condem Turkey's actions against the YPG
attributes.background: The Turkish government has insisted for many years that the YPG, a group based mainly of the Kurdish people, a race historically oppressed by the Turkish government, is a terrorist organisation, going as far to blame them for domestic terrorist events in Turkey without any prior evidence or backing.
attributes.additional_details:
The YPG is already a struggling fighting force, backed by several NATO countries in the fight against the international terrorist organisation Daesh. Unlike the YPG whose policies preach equality, peace and democracy, Daesh present an international danger to any country that supports western ideals of freedom and rights for all. The military might of turkey greatly outweighs that of the YPG, which already faces a difficult and long battle against Daesh, one which is greatly hindered by the targeted smart bombs dropped by Turkish jets, constant artillery barrages and mechanized troops on the Turkish border.
massacres and repression:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights_of_Kurdish_people_in_Turkey
Operation 'Olive Branch'
http://www.rudaw.net/english/middleeast/syria/200120181

attributes.action: Require winter tyres on all vehicles from 1st November to 31st March each year
attributes.background: Reduce risk of accidents on roads in winter conditions. Motorists stuck on the motorways in winter like on the M74 16th-17th Jan 2018 less likely. Uncleared roads generally still passable. Makes the roads safer for those who use winter tyres already.

attributes.action: Restore expatriate Pensioners in Spain their Winter Fuel Allowance.
attributes.background: Expat Pensioners have paid into the system and require parity with Pensioners in the UK. If it is right for UK residents it must be right for Spanish expatriates to receive their allowance.
attributes.additional_details: When the temperatures drop in winter, as they do in the UK, pensioners in Spain need to burn wood to keep their homes warm - homes that have been designed to remain cold in summer become very cold in winter. A great many pensioners are not wealthy but just about surviving on their meagre pension income. The seasonal temperature variation can be as much as 50 + centrigade with the temperatures falling below 0 degrees centigrade when the Sun sets in the Winter season.

attributes.action: Scrap English language (IELTs) test for spouse visa
attributes.background: UK has introduced English language test (Ielts), for the family members of British citizens without which its imposible to join them in the uk. I am personally affected by this as I have two kids under the age of 3 and I can’t bring them to the uk because their mum is unable to speak English.
attributes.additional_details: I hope this law is changed which will make it possible for thousands of families around the uk to be united with Their loved ones.I think it’s unfair for a war-torn country like Afghanistan which has been and is in war since 1978, how can the uk government expect such uneducated population to read and write their own language let alone speak English.

attributes.action: All new build homes built in the last 5 years to be granted freehold interest.
attributes.background: Adverse publicity of developers including unreasonable clauses within leases on new houses has led to government consultation.  Developers should not hold power over new home buyers upon legal completion of the house.  People who buy a new build house want to be freeholders not tenants!

attributes.action: Stop plans for Bradwell Nuclear Plant
attributes.background: This area is perfect for renewal energy, wind farms, solar.  Nuclear is totally unnecessary. Renewable energy is the way forward if designed to be used by the UK and not sold off.

attributes.action: Make 'traffic light' food/drink labelling legally compulsory in the UK.
attributes.background:
One often reads, hears or sees in the news these days that obesity levels in the UK
have reached pandemic proportions,
leading to concerns about the risk of heart disease and diabetes, among other serious and life-changing illnesses.
attributes.additional_details: A big contributing factor is the amount of excess fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar consumed by the average UK citizen on a daily basis. There is a clear system available called the "traffic lights", whereby food and drink items can be rated using red (high), amber (medium) and green (low) images to simply and clearly indicate how much fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar are contained in 100 grams or 100 millilitres of an item. As I understand it use of the traffic lights is currently voluntary.

attributes.action: Remove variable speed cameras or only put them in action for emergencies
attributes.background: The removal of the variable speed cameras would cut congestion dramatically it will also prevent as many crashes in these areas from people slamming their brakes on when they approach a ridiculous 40mph
attributes.additional_details: When the cameras have been off over Christmas no traffic at all on the m4 past Newport at the same time when the cameras are in action you can expect tailbacks that also cause high emissions from stop start traffic caused by these variable limits they should either be removed or only used if there are lanes blocked

attributes.action: To have a UK referendum on the colour of the UKGB passport post Brexit.
attributes.background: The government has announced that the UK will be returning to a navy blue passport post Brexit. As Brexit is about building a new future, a return to its navy origins can be considered looking backwards. There should be a choice of colours for people to choose from to represent this new beginning.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_wheel

attributes.action: Increase the amount of money that a person signed off work on sick pay receives.
attributes.background: I'm currently receiving sick pay of £360 a month, due to being hit by a car off my motorcycle by a car driver resulting in breaking my shoulder. The £360 a month that i receive soon disappears due to bills and it's very hard to live off of this amount of money a month, when i physically cannot work.
attributes.additional_details: I'm creating this petition to help others in my situation, who physically cannot work due to a motor vehicle accident. Crashes, accidents and injuries sometimes cannot be helped, if you've been injured from the same case to mine or one similar, why should the injured party suffer due to carelessness of another person? It's certainly not fair that the injured party has to live off of £360 a month when the other person can go back to work and earn their standard living wages a month.

attributes.action: Persistent drunk drivers with 3 or more should be banned from driving for life.
attributes.background: Norfolk Police have arrested 57 people in 9 days for driving over the limit.
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are repeat drink driving offenders.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-24281043

Too many persistent offenders serve a short ban and are then able to reapply for their licences. For those who are clearly never going to learn we need the ultimate sanction. Fines and imprisonment are not enough. A lifetime driving ban will keep the roads safe for the vast majoriry of sensible drivers.

attributes.action: Retest EVERY driver every 10 years when photo card licence needs to be renewed.
attributes.background:
Currently, driving licences last until the holder reaches 70 years, but the photograph on their licence must be updated every 10 years. 
As an Approved Driving Instructor (ADI) I have to be re-tested every so-often to prove that I am "up to standard". Why not apply the same rule to all drivers?
attributes.additional_details: Driving licence photos must be renewed every 10 years. MANY drivers say "I couldn't pass my test again". We (ADI's) are required to teach "safe driving for life". Rules change. Signs change. Road layouts change. Change the licence requirements. DVSA could call the renewing licence holder for a "check" free of charge. If the licence holder passes their check DVLA will issue a renewed licence. If the holder fails the check their licence would be suspended until they pay for each check and pass.

attributes.action: Stop councils having to pay when planning decisions are overturned on appeal
attributes.background: Having spoken to local councillors it would appear the councils are becoming unwilling to deny planning because of the costs involved if overturned at appeal. This needs to stop or will end up with councils unwilling to do their best for the people, purely based on money.
attributes.additional_details: I feel the need to ask this question having been witness to the completely inappropriate and ill advised project to double the size of a small village in North Warwickshire.

attributes.action: Introduce a new law to ban cyclists to ride on dual carriageways.
attributes.background: To cycle is a good activity to keep you fit and to impact less on the environment. The problem arises when a cyclist decides to take a ride on a dual carriageway: with motorised vehicles going as fast as 70mph the likelihood of an accident are high, especially at night.

attributes.action: All England, Scotland and Wales national team games available on freeview TV
attributes.background: I am English and I want to see my national team play.  I follow Rugby Union but I am unable to see live coverage of England games during the Rugby Union autumn international tests because I have to subscribe to SKY.
